_header: God made all mankind [God made all mankynd]
_description: On the influences of the elements, humours, and zodiac upon the body, and on phlebotomy — 132 lines, generally in couplets

BodAsh210.First Lines:
God made all mankynd þat lyues on þe ertheOf iiij
                    elementys als we in bokys rede…
BodAsh210.Last Lines:
…þit þis is xij syns in þe ȝodyak
                    spereþat er synid to þe xij partys of þe lyms
                    sere…
BodAsh210.Editions:
Mooney,  Linne R. 
             “A Middle English Verse Compendium of Astrological Medicine.” 
             Medical History
         28 (1984): 406-19: 411-19.

BLSl610.First Lines:
God mad al mankynde þat lyues on þis ertheof foure
                    elementis als we in boke rede…
BLSl610.Last Lines:
…þe bus blede on alle foure þi balis for to
                    bete& sithen wiþ vinegre harde frote þi fetefayr be
                    falle þe blod later
BLSl610.Editions:
Pettigrew,  Thomas Joseph. 
             “Observations upon the Extracts from an Ancient English Medical MS. in
                the Royal Library of Stockholm.” 
             Archaeologia
         30 (1844): 419-29: 420 (extract).
Mooney,  Linne R. 
             “Practical Didactic Works in Middle English.” 
         Diss. Toronto, 1981. 
Mooney,  Linne R. 
             “A Middle English Verse Compendium of Astrological Medicine.” 
             Medical History
         28 (1984): 406-19: 411-19 (excerpts).
